lead_paragraph: With their move approved by the team owners, the Rams will give the Los Angeles area its first N.F.L. team since the Rams and the Raiders left in 1995. The Chargers have the option to join them as soon as next season.

byline.contributor: Mark Leibovich contributed reporting from Houston, and Mike Tierney from Los Angeles.

headline.print_headline: With Rams, N.F.L. Replants Flag in Los Angeles
headline.main: Rams Moving to Los Angeles Area, and Chargers Could Join Them

snippet: With their move approved by the team owners, the Rams will give the Los Angeles area its first N.F.L. team since the Rams and the Raiders left in 1995. The Chargers have the option to join them as soon as next season.
abstract: St Louis Rams will return to Los Angeles after over two decades away, giving area its first NFL team since 1995; team plans to build $3 billion stadium in Inglewood, Calif; San Diego Chargers will have option to relocate to Los Angeles as well, in what would be unprecedented move of two NFL teams to same city in same year.
